title: Mordon Malitoli
text:
Mordon Malitoli (born 5 August 1968) is a former <a href="Zambia%20national%20football%20team">Zambia international</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> defender who played for clubs in <a href="Zambia">Zambia</a>, <a href="Zanzibar">Zanzibar</a> and <a href="Finland">Finland</a>.
Playing career.
Born in <a href="Mufulira">Mufulira</a>, Malitoli began playing club football for local side <a href="Nkana%20F.C.">Nkana F.C.</a>. In over a decade with the club, he won seven <a href="Zambian%20Premier%20League">Zambian Premier League</a> titles, five <a href="Zambian%20Cup">Zambian Cup</a> titles and finished second in the <a href="1990%20African%20Cup%20of%20Champions%20Clubs">1990 African Cup of Champions Clubs</a>.
Later in his career, Malitoli played in Zanzibar with <a href="Malindi%20F.C.">Malindi F.C.</a> and in Finland with <a href="Rovaniemen%20Palloseura">Rovaniemen Palloseura</a>.
Malitoli made several appearances for the senior <a href="Zambia%20national%20football%20team">Zambia national football team</a>, including six <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> qualifying matches, and he participated in the <a href="1994%20African%20Cup%20of%20Nations">1994</a>, <a href="1996%20African%20Cup%20of%20Nations">1996</a> and <a href="1998%20African%20Cup%20of%20Nations">1998 African Cup of Nations</a> finals.
Personal.
Malitoli was the fifth of eight children and his brother, <a href="Kenneth%20Malitoli">Kenneth</a>, is also a former Zambia international footballer.
